|accessdate=2007-12-12|date=2007-08-08}} || July 20, 2007{{cite web|url= http://uk.gear.ign.com/articles/807/807141p1.html|title=Canadians To Get Crimson-Black DS Lite? With Brain Age 2 Combo Pack.| publisher=IGN|accessdate=2007-08-08|date=2007-07-20}}|| August 21, 2007 (Bundle)
October 2, 2007{{cite web|url=https://www.nintendo.com/whatsnew/detail/-CnDUo2gIf-euc-KjYdB_BjOLcikhpwC|title=Nintendo Goes Fashion Forward with New Crimson/Onyx Nintendo DS |publisher=Nintendo|accessdate=2007-12-12 |date=2007-10-02}} (Unbundled)|| North America|| Bundled with ''[[Brain Age 2: More Training in Minutes a Day!]]'' |- | Cobalt/Black{{cite web|url=https://www.nintendo.com/whatsnew/detail/t1mytPWJ2toKtCMAlD4q8_O9114EM9H1|title=Nintendo DS Gets a Fashion-Forward New Color Scheme: Cobalt/Black|accessdate=2008-02-06|date=2008-02-01|publisher=Nintendo}}|| February 2, 2008|| February 10, 2008|| North America|| |- | Metallic Rose || || June 2008|| North America|| |- | Metallic Silver{{cite web|url=https://www.nintendo.com/whatsnew/detail/Mb4KbSoMlBtp1k1K1C-SKC2mkRZvTFU7|title=Nintendo DS Fans Have a Hot New Color for the Fall: Metallic Silver|date=2008-09-02| publisher=[[Nintendo]]|accessdate=2008-09-10}}|| || September 7, 2008|| North America|| Discontinued February 10, 2009{{cite web|last=Harris |first=Craig |url=http://uk.ds.ign.com/articles/952/952961p1.html |title=IGN: Nintendo Prepping for DSi at Retail? |publisher=Ds.ign.com |date=2009-02-10 |accessdate=2009-07-21}} |- | White|| || June 23, 2006|| Europe|| |- | Smart Black || || June 23, 2006|| Europe|| |- | Coral Pink|| || October 27, 2006|| Europe|| |- | Platinum{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.fr/dp/B000W007Y2 |title=Console Nintendo DS Lite - Coloris Argent: Jeux vidéo |publisher=Amazon.fr |date= |accessdate=2009-07-21}} || || October 12, 2007 || Europe|| |- | Red{{cite web|url=https://www.nintendo.co.uk/NOE/en_GB/news/2008/new_ds_colours_and_cooking_guide_on_the_way_8529.html|archive-url=https://archive.is/20120905193511/http://www.nintendo.co.uk/NOE/en_GB/news/2008/new_ds_colours_and_cooking_guide_on_the_way_8529.html|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2012-09-05|title=New DS colours and cooking guide on the way|accessdate=2008-09-13|date=2008-05-21|publisher=Nintendo}}|| || June 13, 2008|| Europe|| |- | Green|| || June 13, 2008|| Europe|| |- | Turquoise|| || June 13, 2008|| Europe|| |- | Ice Blue || November 25, 2008|| November 28, 2008|| Europe|| Limited [[Black Friday (shopping)|Black Friday]] bundle with ''[[Brain Age: Train Your Brain in Minutes a Day!]]'' |} === Limited editions === * '''''Final Fantasy III'' edition''': Announced on July 12, 2006, and released in conjunction with the [[Final Fantasy III (Nintendo DS)|''Final Fantasy III'' remake]] in Japan. These featured a Crystal White Nintendo DS Lite, with ''Final Fantasy III'' artwork by [[Akihiko Yoshida]]. It is priced at [[Japanese yen|¥]]22,780 ([[United States dollar|US$]]193.76). * '''Pokémon DAISUKI Club edition:''' On July 13, 2006, it was revealed that, in conjunction with the promotion for [[Pokémon Diamond and Pearl|''Pokémon Diamond'' and ''Pearl'']], a limited run of special Nintendo DS Lites would be available through a drawing open to members of the Japanese "Pokémon DAISUKI Club". These featured Crystal White Nintendo DS Lites with the popular ''[[Pokémon]]'' character [[Pikachu]] artwork on the front.{{cite web |url=http://www.pokemon.jp/portal/daisuki/ds.cfm |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060902174741/http://www.pokemon.jp/portal/daisuki/ds.cfm |archivedate=2006-09-02|title=Official website for Pokémon |publisher=[[Nintendo]]|language=Japanese|accessdate=2006-07-29}} * '''Pokémon Dialga and Palkia edition:''' An onyx DS Lite featuring a glitter design of the two legendary Pokémon from [[Pokémon Diamond and Pearl|''Pokémon Diamond'' and ''Pearl'']], [[Dialga]] and [[Palkia]], on the front, was released in [[Pokémon Center#Real-world Pokémon Centers|Pokémon Center]] stores on September 28, 2006, retailing for JPY¥16,800.{{cite web|url=http://www.cubed3.com/news/5847 |title=Pokémon Diamond/Pearl Themed DS Lite |publisher=Cubed3 |accessdate=2008-08-18}} This DS Lite launched in the U.S. at the [[Nintendo World Store]] in [[New York City]] at a price of US$219.99{{Citation needed|date=August 2008}} in conjunction with the release of ''Pokémon Diamond'' and ''Pearl''. On May 15, 2007{{Citation needed|date=February 2008}}, Pokémon Center stores released the special edition DS Lite in a bundle that included both games, a scenario guide, and three pins featuring Dialga, Palkia, and one of the starters for US$329.95.{{cite web |url=http://www.pokemoncenter.com/invt/4892 |title=Pokémon Diamond & Pokémon Pearl DS Lite Bundle |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070616133927/http://www.pokemoncenter.com/invt/4892 |archivedate=2007-06-16 |accessdate=2008-08-18}} This version of the DS Lite was the power poll prize in v217 of ''[[Nintendo Power]]''.{{Citation needed|date=July 2008}} On August 17, 2008, this limited edition DS Lite was released as part of the "Nintendo DS Limited Edition Pokémon Pack".{{cite press release |url=http://uk.ds.gamespy.com/nintendo-ds/pokemon-platinum/897815p1.html |title=Limited Edition Pokemon DS Pack (DS) |date=2008-08-11 |publisher=Nintendo |accessdate=2008-08-18}}{{cite press release |url=http://uk.ds.ign.com/articles/897/897841p1.html |title=Nintendo Thrills Pokémon Fans with New DS Limited-Edition Pokémon Pack |date=2008-08-11 |publisher=Nintendo |accessdate=2008-08-18}}{{cite web|url=http://www.pokemon.com/#news_/XML/news_290.xml |title=Nintendo DS Pokémon Pack |date=2008-08-11 |work=The Official Pokémon website |publisher=Nintendo |format=[[Adobe Flash Player]] |accessdate=2008-08-18 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080815091414/http://www.pokemon.com/ |archivedate=August 15, 2008 }} * '''''Giratina Origin Forme'' Nintendo DS Lite''' A limited edition DS lite available though [[Club Nintendo]] Europe from the 28th of May 2009. * '''''Jump Ultimate Stars'' bundle:''' A limited edition DS Lite with the game ''[[Jump Ultimate Stars]]''. It has the words "JUMP ULTIMATE STARS" printed on its case, along with the ''[[Weekly Jump]]'' mascot, the Jump Pirate.{{cite web |title=Jump Ultimate Stars DS Lite|url=http://img101.imagevenue.com/img.php?image=23892_date22554_122_469lo.jpg}} * '''''Love and Berry'' bundle:''' A limited edition DS Lite bundle based on a popular Japanese arcade game, ''[[Oshare Majo: Love and Berry|Love and Berry]]''. It is metallic pink and comes with a card reader and cards. * '''''Winning Eleven'' bundle:''' A limited edition Jet Black DS Lite bundle, which comes with the football game ''[[Winning Eleven]]''. * '''''Mario vs. Donkey Kong'' edition:''' [[K-Zone]] had a competition in between March 7, 2007, and March 19, 2007, that had twenty ''[[Mario vs. Donkey Kong 2: March of the Minis]]'' DS Lites as prizes.{{cite web |title=The competition is mentioned on the official K-Zone website |publisher=Web.archive.org |url=http://au.blogs.yahoo.com/kzone/916/k-zone-winnersmarch/ |accessdate=2010-04-26 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070819232533/http://au.blogs.yahoo.com/kzone/916/k-zone-winnersmarch/ |archivedate=2007-08-19}} * '''''Final Fantasy XII Revenant Wings'' Sky Pirates edition''': A ''[[Final Fantasy XII: Revenant Wings]]'' bundle was released in Japan on April 26, 2007. * '''''Pirates of the Caribbean'' edition''': At the world premiere of ''[[Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End]]'' on May 19, 2007, models with a ''[[Pirates of the Caribbean]]'' skull and crossbones on the front were released, with [[Captain Jack Sparrow]] in front of a castle with the text "Where the adventure comes to life" on the back. These were only released to ticket holders at the ''Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End'' premiere at [[Disneyland]]. [[HMV]] Canada is holding a contest from August 21, 2007, to October 1, 2007, called "HMV Underground", where one of the prizes is a [[Disney]] limited edition DS console and a ''Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End'' game.[http://www.hmv.ca/rules.php]{{Dead link|date=April 2010}} * '''Seattle Mariners edition''': 2,000 White DS Lites emblazoned with the [[Seattle Mariners]] logo on the lower-right of the lid were made available for purchase at [[Safeco Field]] during 2007.{{cite web |title=Seattle Mariners DS: exactly what the US market needs |publisher=DSFanboy.com |url=http://nintendo.joystiq.com/2007/05/18/seattle-mariners-ds-exactly-what-the-us-market-needs/ |accessdate=2007-05-23}} On September 15, 2007, Nintendo released a total of 16 white DS Lites, which were identical to the Seattle Mariners DS Lite units but with autographs. They were given away randomly at Safeco Field. * '''Pokémon Center Pikachu edition''': Yellow DS Lites which features [[Pikachu]] on the front cover were released in Japan. Buyers had to visit a [[Pokémon Center#Real-world Pokémon Centers|Pokémon Center]] in Japan between June 1, 2007, and July 1, 2007, and fill in an application form for a chance to win a right to buy the console for [[Japanese yen|JPY¥]]16,800.{{cite web |title=Pokémon Center Pikachu Edition |url=http://www.pokemon.co.jp/info/pokemon/p070601_02.html |accessdate=2007-06-01 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070716233115/http://www.pokemon.co.jp/info/pokemon/p070601_02.html |archivedate=2007-07-16}} On November 17, 2007, the special DS Lite was released in a bundle pack for US$345.95.{{cite web |title=Pikachu DS Lite Ultimate Bundle |url=http://www.pokemoncenter.com/invt/5012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071118162921/http://www.pokemoncenter.com/invt/5012 |archivedate=2007-11-18}} * '''RX-93 ν Gundam edition''': White DS Lites which feature the same red branding seen on [[Amuro Ray]]'s RX-93 ν Gundam in the animated film, ''[[Mobile Suit Gundam: Char's Counterattack]]''. The red logo appears on the left and the wording "RX-93 ν Gundam Mobile Suit Gundam Char's Counterattack" printed on the right. This edition goes on sale in Japan on August 9, 2007, and retails at [[Japanese yen|JPY¥]]21,840, with [[SD Gundam G Generation|SD Gundam G Generation Cross Drive]]. Released by [[Namco Bandai Games|Bandai Namco]].{{cite web |title=RX-93 ν Gundam edition |url=http://www.ggene.jp/goods.html |accessdate=2007-05-11 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070513034650/http://www.ggene.jp/goods.html |archivedate=2007-05-13}} * '''''Wonderful World'' edition''': Gloss Silver DS Lites feature the black ''[[The World Ends with You|It's a Wonderful World]]'' logo on the left with the title of the game printed on the right. This edition goes on sale in Japan on July 27, 2007. Released by [[Square Enix]].{{cite web|url= http://game.watch.impress.co.jp/docs/20070531/suba.htm|title=Wonderful World edition|accessdate=2007-06-01}} * '''''Kirby: Squeak Squad'' edition''': [[K-Zone]] held a competition in between April 16, 2007, and July 9, 2007, they gave away forty ''[[Kirby: Squeak Squad]]'' Nintendo DS Lites as a winning prize . * '''''Final Fantasy Crystal Chronicles: Ring of Fates'' Gemini edition''': Being released on August 23, 2007, in conjunction with ''[[Final Fantasy Crystal Chronicles: Ring of Fates]]'' in Japan. This features a Crystal White Nintendo DS Lite with black ''Ring of Fates'' line art on the right and the title of the game on the left. It is priced at [[Japanese yen|JPY¥]]21,840 ([[United States dollar|US$]]176).{{cite web |url=http://www.qj.net/qjnet/nintendo-ds/the-final-fantasy-crystal-chronicles-ring-of-fates-ds-bundle-and-screenshots.html |title=Final Fantasy Crystal Chronicles: Ring of Fates bundle |publisher=[[Square Enix]]|accessdate=2007-06-22}} * '''Nintendo Connection Tour '07 edition''': During June and July 2007, [[Nintendo Australia]] gave out a very limited edition Black DS Lite with an engraving of "Nintendo DS Connection Tour '07 Champion". There are only 15 in the world—one for each champion at each of the [[Pokémon Diamond and Pearl|''Pokémon Diamond'' and ''Pearl'']] tournaments during the Australia-wide tour. * '''''Wario: Master of Disguise'' edition''': Continuing their DS Lite promotion, [[K-Zone]] held a competition until September 10, 2007, that had forty ''[[Wario: Master of Disguise]]'' DS Lites as prizes.[http://au.blogs.yahoo.com/kzone/959/wario-master-of-disguise-ds-lite-promo/]{{Dead link|date=July 2009}} The Wario: MoD/K-Zone competition * '''''Super Mario 64 DS'' iQue DS edition''': In [[China]], another edition of the DS Lite will be released under the iQue name.{{citation needed|date=June 2013}} [[Image:Zeldagold ds closed.jpg|150px|thumb|''Zelda'' Triforce Gold Edition]] * '''''The Legend of Zelda: Phantom Hourglass'' edition''': On November 20, 2007, Nintendo announced a special edition gold DS Lite bundled with ''[[The Legend of Zelda: Phantom Hourglass]]'', which was released in the [[United States]] on November 23, 2007 ([[Black Friday (shopping)|Black Friday]]).{{cite web|url=http://www.pcworld.com/article/id,139803/article.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071203115255/http://www.pcworld.com/article/id%2C139803/article.html |archivedate=2007-12-03 |title=Nintendo Offers New DS Bundles for the Holidays |publisher=[[PC World (magazine)|PC World]] |accessdate=2007-11-21 |date=2007-11-20 |deadurl=yes |df= }} It is a gold-colored DS Lite with a Triforce image in the bottom-right corner on the top of the outside. In the [[United Kingdom]], a silver DS Lite bundle was released with an image of Link on the left side and the Phantom Hourglass logo on the right. * '''''Nintendogs'' edition''': On November 20, 2007, Nintendo also announced a special edition metallic rose DS Lite bundled with ''[[Nintendogs]]: Best Friends'', which was released in the [[United States]] on November 23, 2007 ([[Black Friday (shopping)|Black Friday]]). It has a pink image of a paw in the bottom-right corner of the outside of the DS Lite's top screen. * '''''Warhammer 40,000: Squad Command'' edition''': [[THQ]] announced a competition to win a special edition DS Lite bearing a design similar to the power armor worn by the [[Ultra Marines|Ultramarines]]. The design was created in conjunction with Games Workshop and a team of modelers: they were blue with a Warhammer design featuring gold wings surrounding a white skull that protruded off the lid by 1 cm. They were released only in the U.K. The design is limited to only six consoles.{{cite web |url=http://www.thq-games.com/uk/news/show/3067 |title=THQ UK - News: Exclusive competition! Win a Limited Edition Warhammer 40,000: Squad Command DS |publisher=[[THQ]] |accessdate=2007-12-18 |date=2007-12-18 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071209172521/http://www.thq-games.com/uk/news/show/3067 |archivedate=2007-12-09 |df= }} * '''Crimson/Black Dragon iQue DS''': In China, with laser-etched dragons on the cover.{{Cite news|url=https://www.engadget.com/2007/12/21/the-crimson-and-black-lite-we-should-have-received/|title=The crimson and black Lite we should have received|last=Greenhough|first=Chris|date=December 21, 2007|work=Engadget|access-date=March 17, 2018|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en-US}} * '''Bape Milo edition''': Released in Japan on April 1, 2008, by Japanese Fashion Designer Nigo, A Bathing Ape{{cite web|author=Laurel |url=http://rinkya.blogspot.com/2008/02/nintendo-ds-lite-bape.html |title=Bape Milo DS Edition |publisher=Rinkya.blogspot.com |date=2008-02-26 |accessdate=2010-04-26}} * '''Honeyee x Fragment Design''': Sold on the Honeyee online store between March 19 and March 21, 2008, designed by Hiroshi Fujiwara.{{cite web |url=http://kix-files.com/2008/03/honeyee-fragment-design-nintendo-ds-lite/ |title=Honeyee x Fragment Design |publisher=Kix-files.com |date=2008-03-17 |accessdate=2010-04-26 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110713154351/http://kix-files.com/2008/03/honeyee-fragment-design-nintendo-ds-lite/ |archivedate=2011-07-13 |df= }} * '''''Guitar Hero: On Tour'' edition''': A limited edition Silver/Black DS Lite branded with the ''Guitar Hero'' logo is available in a bundle with ''[[Guitar Hero: On Tour]]''. The bundle coincided with the release of ''Guitar Hero: On Tour'' in North America on June 22, 2008,{{cite press release |url=https://www.nintendo.com/whatsnew/detail/gaKF26g2UoTreTgHvhRbfRGdnMOAy1-- |title=Axe Shredders Hit the Road With New Nintendo DS/Guitar Hero: On Tour Bundle |date=2008-06-12 |publisher=Nintendo |accessdate=2008-08-03}} and in the United Kingdom on July 18, 2008.[[Image:Nintendo DS Mario Edition.jpg|150px|thumb|Limited Edition Mario Red]]{{cite web |url=http://www.computerandvideogames.com/article.php?id=190814 |title=Guitar Hero-branded DS revealed |author=Mike Jackson |date=2008-06-12 |publisher=[[Computer and Video Games]] |accessdate=2008-08-03}} * '''Pink Ribbon DS Lite''': Released in late September 2008, the Polar White DS Lite features a pink ribbon. Nintendo pledges to donate $5 for every system sold to the [[Susan G. Komen for the Cure]] to fight breast cancer.{{cite web|url=https://gizmodo.com/5055184/pink-ribbon-ds-lite-is-an-insult-to-cancer-funding|title=Pink Ribbon DS Lite Is an Insult to Cancer Funding|first=Mark|last=Wilson|publisher=}} * '''Mario Red''': Released November 28, 2008, this edition, unlike the Crimson/Black color, is completely covered in a bright red that best represents [[Mario]]'s cap and shirt colors. It also features an emblazoned "M" on the front cover. For a limited time, it will be bundled with ''[[New Super Mario Bros.]]''. * '''Ice Blue''': Released November 28, 2008, this DS is a holiday exclusive to 2008. It is bundled with ''Brain Age'', and a limited edition ice blue carrying case. The case holds a DS lite, two DS games, and a spare stylus pen. This edition cost an additional US$20 because of the game and case included. * '''Lime Green''': Released May 3, 2009, this Lime Green DS is packaged with a copy of [[Personal Trainer: Cooking]] and a carrying case. The bundle retails for $149.99 and is marketed as a [[Mother's Day]] gift.{{cite web |last=Flatley |first=Joseph L. |date=2009-04-24 |title=Nintendo rolls out lime green DS bundle just in time for Mother's Day |publisher=Engadget.com |url=https://www.engadget.com/2009/04/24/nintendo-rolls-out-lime-green-ds-bundle-just-in-time-for-mother/ |accessdate=2009-07-21}} In Australia, the special edition came out in late May, was exclusive to [[EB Games]], and was sold with [[Animal Crossing: Wild World]].{{cite web|date= |title=Nintendo DS Lite Handheld Console (Green) |publisher=Ebgames.com.au |url=http://www.ebgames.com.au/ds/product.cfm?id=14721&refer=banner |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090901005946/http://www.ebgames.com.au/ds/product.cfm?id=14721&refer=banner |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2009-09-01 |accessdate=2009-07-21 |df= }}{{cite web |title=That page is missing! - EB Games Australia |publisher=Ebgames.com.au |url=http://www.ebgames.com.au/images/products/147553_deal_au.jpg |accessdate=2010-04-26 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100303115300/http://www.ebgames.com.au/images/products/147553_deal_au.jpg |archivedate=March 3, 2010}} *There is also a red Nintendo DS Lite model released in [[North America]], that came bundled with an M&M's Break 'Em cartridge, and a red M&M stuffed toy along with a red colored DS. {{Citation needed|date=September 2008}} *On August 21, 2007, a [[Crimson]]/Onyx DS Lite{{cite web |date=2007-10-02 |title=Nintendo Goes Fashion Forward with New Crimson/Onyx Nintendo DS |publisher=Nintendo |url=https://www.nintendo.com/newsarticle?articleid=-CnDUo2gIf-euc-KjYdB_BjOLcikhpwC |accessdate=2007-11-21 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071015012435/http://www.nintendo.com/newsarticle?articleid=-CnDUo2gIf-euc-KjYdB_BjOLcikhpwC |archivedate=October 15, 2007}} was released. It is bundled with ''[[Brain Age 2: More Training in Minutes a Day!]]''.{{cite web |date=2007-08-08 |title=New Nintendo DS Color Comes Bundled with Brain Age 2 |publisher=[[Nintendo]] |url=https://www.nintendo.com/newsarticle?articleid=p6YV_H74y2x8JQibfas6FxvBRZAW42VD |accessdate=2007-08-09 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070929171725/http://www.nintendo.com/newsarticle?articleid=p6YV_H74y2x8JQibfas6FxvBRZAW42VD |archivedate=September 29, 2007}} Nintendo confirmed this bundle after it was listed by Canadian retail outlet [[Future Shop]]. The listing was picked up and featured on many major online gaming websites such as [[IGN]].{{cite web |date=2007-07-20 |title=Canadians To Get Crimson-Black DS Lite? With Brain Age 2 Combo Pack. |publisher=[[IGN]] |url=http://gear.ign.com/articles/807/807141p1.html |accessdate=2007-08-08}} *On the same day, Nintendo also released a similar color scheme for the DS Lite, known as Cobalt/Onyx, and in certain regions was bundled the same as its Crimson/Onyx color variation. They both feature a glossy upper half of the DS Lite's lid, whereas the rest of the unit is matte black. This varied from earlier Onyx (Black) models as the exterior casings were not done in a matte coating; rather a glossy exterior prone to fingerprints and scratches. *In September 2007, in North America Nintendo released a DS Lite to commemorate the launch of ''Pokémon Diamond'' and ''Pokémon Pearl'' video games. The black Pokémon Nintendo DS Lite was bundled with a special Pokémon cartoon episode and a carrying case. The Pokémon Dialga and Palkia guarded the system's upper lid, etched in gold and silver respectively. The Nintendo DS Lite for a while after was still available in onyx black until supplies ran out; but its casing lacks the Pokémon design. A similar model was released in white around the debut of ''Pokémon Platinum'' Version featuring the Pokémon, Giratina, etched on the lid in grey. *In April 2009, for the launch of ''[[Grand Theft Auto: Chinatown Wars]]'', Nintendo showcased 20 Nintendo DS Lite units, shown in dark navy blue and red with GTA logos on top, displayed at the Nintendo World Store. ==Nintendo DSi== Standard Colors * Black (all region launch color) * Light Blue (NA launch color) * Arctic White (Japan/PAL launch color)(Rare to North America) * Pink * Matte Red (North America) * Matte Blue (North America) * Gloss Red (Japan, Europe) * Metallic Blue * Lime Green (Japan) Limited Edition Colors * '''''[[Kingdom Hearts 358/2 Days]]'' edition''': Japanese exclusive.{{cite web |url=http://www.andriasang.com/e/blog/2009/03/05/kingdom_hearts_358_2_days_date/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2011-08-25 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090804172846/http://www.andriasang.com/e/blog/2009/03/05/kingdom_hearts_358_2_days_date |archivedate=2009-08-04 |df= }} * '''''[[Final Fantasy Crystal Chronicles: Echoes of Time]]'' edition''': Japanese exclusive.{{cite web|url=https://www.ign.com/articles/2008/11/25/dsi-bundle-for-final-fantasy-crystal-chronicles-echoes-of-time|title=DSi Bundle for Final Fantasy Crystal Chronicles Echoes of Time|first=John|last=Tanaka|date=25 November 2008|publisher=}} * '''''[[Saga 2: Goddess of Destiny]]'' edition''': Japanese exclusive. {{cite web|url=http://nintendoeverything.com/the-saga-2-goddess-of-destiny-special-editionlimited-edition-dsi/|title=The SaGa 2: Goddess of Destiny special edition/limited edition DSi - Nintendo Everything|date=26 August 2009|publisher=}} * '''''[[Gyakuten Kenji]]'' edition''': Japanese exclusive.{{cite web|url=https://www.ign.com/articles/2009/04/03/gyakuten-kenji-dsi-for-japan|title=Gyakuten Kenji DSi For Japan|first=John|last=Tanaka|date=3 April 2009|publisher=}} * '''Super Mario Bros. 25th Anniversary''' * '''[[Pokémon Black and White|''Pokémon Black'' and ''White'']] White edition'''{{cite web |url=http://www.andriasang.com/e/blog/2010/10/07/pokemon_black_white_dsi_boxes/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-10-07 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101010031606/http://www.andriasang.com/e/blog/2010/10/07/pokemon_black_white_dsi_boxes/ |archivedate=2010-10-10 |df= }} * '''[[Pokémon Black and White|''Pokémon Black'' and ''White'']] Black edition''' * Metallic Blue 2009 Black Friday Bundle * Orange Mario Party DS 2010 Black Friday Bundle * Green Mario Party DS 2010 Black Friday Bundle ==Nintendo DSi XL/DSi LL== Standard Colors * Burgundy/Wine Red (all region launch color) * Bronze/Dark Brown (all region launch color) * Natural White (Japan launch color) * Midnight Blue/Blue * Green * Yellow * Red (Australia only) * Metallic Rose (NA only) Limited Editions * '''''LovePlus+ '' edition'''{{cite web |url=http://www.andriasang.com/e/blog/2010/06/02/love_plus_plus_special_systems/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-10-07 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100607043040/http://www.andriasang.com/e/blog/2010/06/02/love_plus_plus_special_systems/ |archivedate=2010-06-07 |df= }} * '''''Super Mario Bros. 25th Anniversary'' edition'''{{cite web |url=http://www.andriasang.com/e/blog/2010/09/29/mario_anniversary_dsi/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-10-07 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101003231552/http://www.andriasang.com/e/blog/2010/09/29/mario_anniversary_dsi/ |archivedate=2010-10-03 |df= }} - red with Super Mario Power-up icons on front ==See also== * [[List of Nintendo 3DS colors and styles]] * [[List of Game Boy colors and styles]] * [[Comparison of Nintendo portable consoles]] ==References== {{Reflist|25em}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Colors and styles}} [[Category:Lists of colors|Nintendo DS]] [[Category:Nintendo DS]]

This is a '''list of biodiversity databases'''. Biodiversity databases store [[Taxonomy (biology)|taxonomic]] information which provide information on the [[biodiversity]] of a particular area or group of living organisms. They may store specimen-level information, species-level information, information on nomenclature, or any combination of the above. Most are available online.
Specimen-focused databases contain data about individual specimens, as represented by vouchered museum specimens, collections of specimen photographs, data on field-based specimen observations and morphological or genetic data. Species-focused databases contain information summarised at the species-level. Some species-focused databases attempt to compile comprehensive data about particular species ([[FishBase]]), while others focus on particular species attributes, such as checklists of species in a given area (FEOW) or the conservation status of species ([[CITES]] or [[IUCN Red List]]). Nomenclators act as summaries of taxonomic revisions and set a key between specimen-focused and species-focused databases. They do this because taxonomic revisions use specimen data to determine species limits.

FP 32 or 64 bits | |Full |- | Radio Shack |TRS-80 CoCo 2 | |Microsoft |{{yes}} |{{yes}} |I:16; FP 32 or 64 bits | |Full |- | Radio Shack |TRS-80 CoCo 3 | |Microsoft |{{yes}} |{{yes}} |I:16; FP 32 or 64 bits | |Full |- | Radio Shack |TRS-80 M100 | |Microsoft |{{yes}} |{{yes}} |I:16; FP 32 or 64 bits | |Full |- | Radio Shack |TRS-80 M102 | |Microsoft |{{yes}} |{{yes}} |I:16; FP 32 or 64 bits | |Full |- | Radio Shack |TRS-80 MC-10 | |Microsoft |{{yes}} |{{no}} |FP |2 |Partial |- | Sinclair||ZX81|||||||| |- | Sinclair||ZX Spectrum||||||||{{yes}}||||||Partial |- | Sinclair||ZX Spectrum +2||||||||{{yes}}||||||Partial |- | TI||TI-99/4A||[[TI BASIC (TI 99/4A)|TI BASIC]]||||{{no}}||{{no}}||||||Full |- | TI||[[Texas Instruments Compact Computer 40|CC-40]]||||||{{yes}}||||||2||Full |} BASICs with Bitwise Ops use -1 as true and the AND and OR operators perform a [[bitwise operation]] on the arguments. FOR/NEXT skip means that body of the loop is skipped if the initial value of the loop times the sign of the step exceeds the final value times the sign of the step (such as 2 TO 1 STEP 1 or 1 TO 2 STEP -1). The statements inside the FOR/NEXT loop will not be executed at all.[http://programmers.stackexchange.com/questions/229191 How does BASIC locate an out-of-order NEXT statement when the loop body is skipped]{{cite book|url=https://archive.org/stream/BASIC-80_MBASIC_Reference_Manual#page/n47/mode/2up|page=2–30|title=basic-80 reference manual}} Numeric support indicates if a BASIC supports Integers and/or Floating Point. Variable Name Length is how many characters of a variable name are used to determine uniqueness. Full tokenization means that all keywords are converted to tokens and all extra space characters are removed. Partial tokenization leaves extra space characters in the source. None means that no tokenization is done. How to test for full tokenization: 10 PRINT "HELLO" LIST If it is fully tokenized it should return 10 PRINT "HELLO" without all the extra spaces that were entered. ==References== [[Category:Lists of computer hardware|On-Board Basic]]

page.title: List of people diagnosed with colorectal cancer

revision.comment: Rescuing 1 sources and tagging 0 as dead. #IABot (v2.0beta10)
revision.text:
This article lists notable people who were or have been diagnosed with [[colorectal cancer]].
* [[Audrey Hepburn]] died January 20, 1993 aged 63<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/3667517.stm BBC]</ref>
* [[Antonin Artaud]] French [[dramatist]], [[poet]], [[essayist]], [[actor]], and [[theatre director]], died on 4 March 1948, alone in a psychiatric clinic, at the foot of his bed, clutching his shoe
*[[Neville Chamberlain]], Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, died 9 November, 1940 aged 71<ref>[[Neville Chamberlain]] </ref> *[[Babe Didrikson Zaharias]], American athlete<ref>[http://espn.go.com/sportscentury/features/00014147.html ESPN]</ref> *[[Bob Jenkins]], Auto racing broadcaster<ref name="Couch">{{cite news |url=http://sportscouchpotato.typepad.com/sports_couch_potato/2009/03/versus-indycar-voice-jenkins-a-true-survivor.html |title=Versus' IndyCar voice Jenkins true survivor |publisher=Sports Couch Potato |date=2009-03-12 |accessdate=2009-04-07 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100612083219/http://sportscouchpotato.typepad.com/sports_couch_potato/2009/03/versus-indycar-voice-jenkins-a-true-survivor.html |archivedate=2010-06-12 |df= }}</ref> *[[Bobby Moore]], England Football Captain and World Cup winner 1966, died February 24, 1993 aged 51. The Bobby Moore Fund for Cancer Research UK is committed to beating bowel cancer in his memory.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cancerresearchuk.org/bobbymoorefund/aboutus/ |title=The Bobby Moore Fund |publisher=Cancerresearchuk.org |date= |accessdate=22 March 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100706030140/http://www.cancerresearchuk.org/bobbymoorefund/aboutus/ |archivedate=6 July 2010 |df= }}</ref> *[[Carmen Marc Valvo]], American Evening-wear designer<ref>[http://www.aarpsegundajuventud.org/english/health/2008-WIN/valvo.html AARP SegundaJuventud]</ref> *[[Charles M. Schulz]], creator of [[Peanuts]], died at age 77; 60 days after diagnosis.<ref>[http://archives.cnn.com/2000/US/02/13/schulz.obit.02/index.html CNN]</ref> *[[Claude Debussy]], French composer<ref>{{cite web |url=http://w3.rz-berlin.mpg.de/cmp/debussy.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2009-10-13 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=http://webarchive.loc.gov/all/20011111123614/http://w3.rz-berlin.mpg.de/cmp/debussy.html |archivedate=2001-11-11 |df= }}</ref> *[[Corazon Aquino]], 11th [[President of the Philippines|president]] of the [[Philippines]] who died 1 Aug 2009, aged 76.<ref>http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/storypage.aspx?StoryID=112887{{dead link|date=May 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> *[[Eartha Kitt]] died December 25, 2008 aged 81<ref name="death-fox">{{cite news|url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,472987,00.html|title=Singer, Actress, Dancer Eartha Kitt Dies of Colon Cancer at Age 81|date=2008-12-25|publisher=Fox News|accessdate=2009-06-03}}</ref> *[[Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother]] Developed colon cancer at age 66, died 2002 aged 101<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/8259474.stm]</ref> *[[Elizabeth Montgomery]], American actress, died at age 62, 8 weeks after diagnosis.<ref>[https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0000548/ IMDB]</ref><ref name="news.bbc.co.uk">[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/england/4559861.stm BBC]</ref> *[[Farah Fawcett]], American actress, died at age 62.<ref>[https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0000396/bio?ref_=nm_ov_bio_sm IMDB]</ref> *[[Harold Wilson]], former [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom]] *[[Howard Marks]], Welsh drug smuggler and author<ref>{{cite news|title=Obituary: Howard Marks|url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/howard-marks-hkts5mcb9|accessdate=17 April 2017|publisher=The Times|date=11 April 2016}}</ref> *[[Joel Siegel]], Emmy award-winning film critic and Entertainment Editor of ABC's ''Good Morning America''<ref>[http://articles.latimes.com/2007/jun/30/local/me-siegel30 LA Times]</ref> *[[John Foster Dulles]], U.S. Secretary of State under Republican President Dwight D. Eisenhower.<ref>[http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0512/76679.html Politico]</ref> *[[José Ferrer]], Puerto Rican actor, theater, and film director; died 26 January 1992 at the age of 80.<ref>[http://copingmag.com/cwc/index.php/celebrities/celebrity_article/miguel_ferrer]</ref> *[[TotalBiscuit|John Bain]], Video game commentator, died May 24, 2018, aged 33.<ref>Bain, John. "[https://twitter.com/Totalbiscuit/status/469911657792421889 Twitter / Totalbiscuit]". Twitter. Retrieved 23 May 2014.</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-44250597|title=YouTube star TotalBiscuit dies aged 33|date=25 May 2018|work=[[BBC]]|access-date=25 May 2018}}</ref> *[[Lynn Faulds Wood]], former [[BBC Watchdog]] presenter, survived advanced bowel cancer and founded the charities ''Beating Bowel Cancer'' and ''Lynn's Bowel Cancer Campaign.''<ref>Lynn's Bowel Cancer Campaign|{{cite web |url=http://www.bowelcancer.tv/cgi-bin/page.pl?page=LynnsStory&accessability=no |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2009-10-13 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081025162217/http://www.bowelcancer.tv/cgi-bin/page.pl?page=LynnsStory&accessability=no |archivedate=2008-10-25 |df= }}</ref> *[[Sara Murray Jordan]], gastroenterologist; diagnosed herself with colon cancer and died in 1959 at the age of 75.<ref>{{cite journal|title=Sara Murray Jordan, First Woman President of the American Gastroenterological Association (1942–1944)|journal=[[Gastroenterology (journal)|Gastroenterology]]|first=Gail A.|last=Hecht|year=2009|volume=137|issue=6|pages=1877–1879|doi=10.1053/j.gastro.2009.10.012}}</ref> *[[Malcolm Marshall]], West Indian and Hampshire Cricketer<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/sport/cricket/505421.stm BBC report]</ref> *[[Robin Gibb]], singer, musician and producer, member of the [[Bee Gees]].<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/04/23/colorectal-cancer_n_1446032.html | work=Huffington Post | first=Sarah | last=Klein | title=12 Famous Faces Touched By Colorectal Cancer | date=2012-04-23}}</ref> *[[Rod Roddy]] - second announcer for [[The Price Is Right (U.S. game show)|The Price is Right]], died on October 27, 2003, 2 years after being diagnosed with colon cancer.<ref>[http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2003/10/27/entertainment/main580335.shtml 'Price Is Right's' Rod Roddy Dies] at CBS News</ref> *[[Ronald Reagan]], 40th US President.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/1156513.stm BBC]</ref> *[[Sam Simon]], Co-creator of the TV series [[The Simpsons]]; died 8 March 2015 at the age of 59.<ref>https://www.nytimes.com/2015/03/10/arts/television/sam-simon-who-helped-shape-the-simpsons-dies-at-59.html?_r=0</ref> *[[Sid Waddell]], darts commentator (10 August 1940 - 11 August 2012). Died 11 months after diagnosis<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/darts/15012394.stm BBC]</ref> *[[Simon MacCorkindale]], actor; first diagnosed in 2006; died 14 October 2010.<ref name="bbcdeath">{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-11554922|title=Casualty actor Simon MacCorkindale dies aged 58|publisher=[[BBC News]]|date=2010-10-15|accessdate=2010-10-15}}</ref> *[[Tony Snow]], newscaster and former Press Secretary under President [[George W. Bush]]; died 12 July 2008 at the age of 53.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,381250,00.html# |title=Fox News |access-date=2009-10-13 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090918113838/http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,381250,00.html# |archive-date=2009-09-18 |dead-url=yes |df= }}</ref> *[[Vince Lombardi]] (June 11, 1913 – September 3, 1970), [[American football]] coach of [[Green Bay Packers]] and [[Washington Redskins]]. The [[Super Bowl]] trophy was renamed in his honor shortly after his death, as his Packers won the first two Super Bowls.<ref>[https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=jvrRlaHg2sAC&dat=19700903&printsec=frontpage&hl=en ''Lombardi Dies Of Cancer'' Milwaukee Journal, Sept. 3, 1970, page 1]</ref> *[[Jackie Gleason]], American actor known for portraying Ralph Kramden in [[The Honeymooners]]. *[[Sir Edward Elgar, 1st Baronet|Sir Edward Elgar]], English composer; died 23 February 1934 aged 76, four months after diagnosis.<ref>{{cite book|last=Moore|first=Jerrold N.|title=Edward Elgar: a Creative Life|year=1984|publisher=Oxford University Press|page=818|isbn=0-19-315447-1}}</ref>
== References == {{Reflist}}

page.title: List of quantum-mechanical systems with analytical solutions

revision.text:
Much insight in [[quantum mechanics]] can be gained from understanding the [[closed-form solution]]s to the time-dependent non-relativistic [[Schrödinger equation]] in an appropriate [[Configuration space (physics)|configuration space]]. In vector Cartesian coordinates <math>\mathbf{r}</math>, the equation takes the form
:<math> H \psi\left(\mathbf{r}, t\right) = \left(T + V\right) \, \psi\left(\mathbf{r}, t\right) = \left[ - \frac{\hbar^2}{2m} \nabla^2 + V\left(\mathbf{r}\right) \right] \psi\left(\mathbf{r}, t\right) = i\hbar \frac{\partial\psi\left(\mathbf{r}, t\right)}{\partial t} </math>
in which <math>\psi</math> is the [[wavefunction]] of the system, H is the [[Hamiltonian operator]], and T and V are the operators for the [[kinetic energy]] and [[potential energy]], respectively. (Common forms of these operators appear in the square brackets.) The quantity ''t'' is the time. [[Stationary state]]s of this equation are found by solving the [[eigenvalue]]-[[eigenfunction]] (time-independent) form of the Schrödinger equation,
:<math> \left[ - \frac{\hbar^2}{2m} \nabla^2 + V\left(\mathbf{r}\right) \right] \psi\left(\mathbf{r}\right) = E \psi \left(\mathbf{r}\right) </math>
or any equivalent formulation of this equation in a different coordinate system other than Cartesian coordinates. For example, systems with spherical symmetry are simplified when expressed with [[spherical coordinates]]. Very often, only numerical solutions to the Schrödinger equation can be found for a given physical system and its associated potential energy. However, there exists a subset of physical systems for which the form of the eigenfunctions and their associated energies can be found. These quantum-mechanical systems with analytical solutions are listed below.
== Solvable systems ==
*The [[two-state quantum system]] (the simplest quantum system that can exist) *The [[free particle]] *The [[delta potential]] *The [[Delta potential#Double delta potential|Double well Dirac delta potential]] *The [[particle in a box]] / [[infinite potential well]] *The [[finite potential well]] *The [[Airy function|One-dimensional triangular potential]] *The [[particle in a ring]] or [[ring wave guide]] *The [[particle in a spherically symmetric potential]] *The [[quantum harmonic oscillator]] *The quantum harmonic oscillator with an applied linear field<ref name="Hodgson">[http://etheses.whiterose.ac.uk/15657/] Hodgson, M.J.P., 2016. Electrons in model nanostructures (Doctoral dissertation, University of York) pages 122-124.</ref> *The [[hydrogen atom]] or [[hydrogen-like atom]] e.g. [[positronium]] *The [[hydrogen atom]] in a spherical cavity with [[Dirichlet boundary condition|Dirichlet boundary conditions]]<ref>T.C. Scott and Wenxing Zhang, ''Efficient hybrid-symbolic methods for quantum mechanical calculations'', [[Computer Physics Communications|Comput. Phys. Commun.]] '''191''', pp. 221-234, 2015 [http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0010465515000545].</ref> *The [[particle in a one-dimensional lattice (periodic potential)]] *The [[Morse potential]] *The [[step potential]] *The [[Rigid rotor#Quantum mechanical linear rigid rotor|linear rigid rotor]] *The [[Rigid rotor#Quantum mechanical rigid rotor|symmetric top]] *The [[Hooke's atom]] *The [[Spherium]] atom *Zero range interaction in a harmonic trap<ref>{{Cite journal | last1 = Busch | first1 = Thomas| last2 = Englert | first2 = Berthold-Georg | last3 = Rzażewski | first3 = Kazimierz | last4 = Wilkens | first4 = Martin | doi = 10.1023/A:1018705520999 | title = Two Cold Atoms in a Harmonic Trap | journal = Foundations of Physics | volume = 27 | issue = 4 | pages = 549–559 | year = 1998 | url=https://link.springer.com/article/10.1023/A:1018705520999}}</ref> *The [[Quantum pendulum]] *The [[Rectangular potential barrier]] *The [[Pöschl-Teller potential]] *The [[Inverse square root potential]]<ref>{{Cite journal | last1 = Ishkhanyan | first1 = A. M.| doi = 10.1209/0295-5075/112/10006 | title = Exact solution of the Schrödinger equation for the inverse square root potential <math>V_{0} /\sqrt{x}</math> | journal = Europhysics Letters | volume = 112 | issue = 1 | pages = 10006 | year = 2015 | arxiv=1509.00019}}</ref> *The [[Lambert-W step-potential]] * Multistate Landau–Zener Models<ref name='sinitsyn-17jpa'>{{cite arxiv|title=The Quest for Solvable Multistate Landau-Zener Models|author1=N. A. Sinitsyn |author2=V. Y. Chernyak |eprint=1701.01870|year=2017|class=quant-ph }}</ref> *The [[Luttinger liquid]] (the only exact quantum mechanical solution to a model including interparticle interactions)
== See also == * [[List of quantum-mechanical potentials]] – a list of physically relevant potentials without regard to analytic solubility * [[List of integrable models]] * [[WKB approximation]]
==References== {{reflist}}
== Reading materials ==
* {{cite book | last = Mattis | first = Daniel C. | authorlink = Daniel C. Mattis | title = The Many-Body Problem: An Encyclopedia of Exactly Solved Models in One Dimension | publisher = [[World Scientific]] | date = 1993 | isbn = 981-02-0975-4}}
[[Category:Quantum mechanics]] [[Category:Quantum models]] [[Category:Physics-related lists|Quantum-mechanical systems with analytical solutions]]

page.title: List of things named after Nikola Tesla

revision.text:
This article is a list of things named after [[Nikola Tesla]], an influential physicist, engineer and inventor.
==Science & engineering== * [[Tesla coil]] ** [[Singing Tesla coil]] * [[Tesla's Egg of Columbus]] * [[Tesla Experimental Station]] * [[Tesla's oscillator]] * [[Tesla principle]] * [[Wardenclyffe Tower|Tesla tower]] * [[Tesla turbine]] * [[Tesla (unit)]], an SI-derived unit for magnetic inductivity * [[Tesla valve]]
===Astronomical bodies=== * [[Tesla (crater)|Tesla]], a 26 kilometer-wide crater on the far side of the moon<ref name="Minorplanet">{{cite book|title=Dictionary of minor planet names|last=Schmadel|first=Lutz D.|year=2003|publisher=Springer|isbn=3-540-00238-3|page=183|url=https://books.google.com/?id=KWrB1jPCa8AC|accessdate=28 November 2010}}</ref> * [[2244 Tesla]], a minor planet<ref name="Minorplanet"/>
==Other== ===Awards=== * The [[IEEE Nikola Tesla Award|Nikola Tesla Award]]<ref>{{cite web |last=Vujovic |first=Dr. Ljubo |title=Tesla Biography NIKOLA TESLA THE GENIUS WHO LIT THE WORLD |url=http://www.teslasociety.com/biography.htm |publisher=Tesla Memorial Society of New York |accessdate=30 April 2012}}</ref> * [[Nikola Tesla Satellite Award]]
===Biographical works=== * [[My Inventions: The Autobiography of Nikola Tesla]] * [[Prodigal Genius: The Life of Nikola Tesla]] *[[Tesla - Lightning in His Hand]] * [[The Inventions, Researches, and Writings of Nikola Tesla]] * [[The Secret of Nikola Tesla]]
===Enterprises and organizations=== * [[Tesla (Czechoslovak company)|Tesla]], an electrotechnical conglomerate in former Czechoslovakia * [[Tesla, Inc.|Tesla, Inc]], an American electric car manufacturer<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.teslamotors.com/learn_more/why_tesla.php|title=Why the Name "Tesla?"|publisher=Tesla Motors|accessdate=10 June 2008|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071016044752/http://www.teslamotors.com/learn_more/why_tesla.php|archivedate=16 October 2007}}</ref> * [[Ericsson Nikola Tesla]], Croatian affiliate of the [[Sweden|Swedish]] [[telecommunication]]s equipment manufacturer [[Ericsson]]<ref>{{cite book|title=Amazing Scientists: Inspirational Stories|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=EUQW1p4tYgkC&pg=PT163&lpg=PT163&dq=ericsson+nikola+tesla+croatia&source=bl&ots=NHuuj4865O&sig=7LL-wTdzp6bi8LD8FJVVA2AoM68&hl=en&sa=X&ei=Kec-VdvKLKPksATK6IHgDw&ved=0CD4Q6AEwBzgK#v=onepage&q=ericsson%20nikola%20tesla%20croatia&f=false|author=Margerison, Charles|publisher=Amazing People Club|date=2011|isbn=978-1-921752-40-7|accessdate=28 April 2015}}</ref> *[[Nikola Tesla Museum]] * [[Tesla Electric Light and Manufacturing]] * The Tesla Society, founded in 1956<ref>{{harvnb|Seifer|2001|p=464}}</ref> * Udruženje za razvoj nauke Nikola Tesla, [[Novi Sad]], Serbia<ref>{{cite web|title=nikolatesla.io.ua|url=http://nikolatesla.io.ua/|website=nikolatesla.io.ua|accessdate=15 January 2017}}</ref> * Zavičajno udruženje Krajišnika Nikola Tesla, [[Plandište]], Serbia<ref>{{cite web|title=Zavičajno udruženje Krajišnika Nikola Tesla - Plandište :: Naslovna strana|url=http://www.zuknikolatesla.org/|website=www.zuknikolatesla.org|accessdate=15 January 2017}}</ref> * Tesla Bank, Zagreb, Croatia<ref>http://www.tesla-banka.hr/</ref>
===Holidays and events=== * Nikola Tesla Day in [[Croatia]], 10 July<ref>{{cite web|title=National Day of Nikola Tesla - Day of Science, Technology and Innovation, July 10|url=http://www.dziv.hr/en/news/national-day-of-nikola-tesla---day-of-science-technology-and-innovation-july-10,263.html|publisher=State Intellectual Property Office of the Republic of Croatia|work=DZIV |accessdate=13 July 2015}}</ref> * Day of Nikola Tesla, Association of Teachers in [[Vojvodina]], 4–10 July.<ref>{{cite web|title=Dan Nikole Tesle|publisher=Vojvodina Online|url=http://vojvodinaonline.com/manifestacije/dan-nikole-tesle-dan-nauke-u-srbiji-novi-sad/?lang=SR|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150315185617/http://vojvodinaonline.com/manifestacije/dan-nikole-tesle-dan-nauke-u-srbiji-novi-sad/?lang=SR|archivedate=March 15, 2015|language=sr}}</ref> * Day of Nikola Tesla, Niagara Falls, 10 July.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Radulovic|first1=Bojan|title=Srpska škola|url=http://www.srpskaskola.ca|website=www.srpskaskola.ca|accessdate=15 January 2017}}</ref> * Nikola Tesla annual electric vehicle rally in Croatia<ref>{{cite web|title=Nikola Tesla EV Rally – Croatia 2015 – Electric Rally – Mixture of Excellence and Technology|url=http://www.nikolateslaevrally.com.hr|publisher=Kilovat Media|website=www.nikolateslaevrally.com.hr|accessdate=28 April 2015}}</ref>
===Music=== * [[Tesla (band)|Tesla]], an American rock band formed in Sacramento, California, in late 1982 * [[Tesla Boy]] * "[[Tesla Girls]]", a song by British pop band [[Orchestral Manoeuvres in the Dark]], released in 1984 * Tesla Cøils, an Australian electronic band
===Places=== * [[Belgrade Nikola Tesla Airport]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.airport-desk.com/airports/europe/serbia/belgrade-nikola-tesla-airport.html |title=Belgrade Nikola Tesla Airport|publisher=airport-desk.com|accessdate=29 November 2010}}</ref> * [[Nikola Tesla Museum]] Archive in [[Belgrade]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.unesco.org/new/en/communication-and-information/flagship-project-activities/memory-of-the-world/homepage|title=Memory of the World | United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization|publisher=UNESCO|accessdate=10 September 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.teslasociety.com/archive.htm |title=Tesla Memorial Society of New York Homepage |website=Teslasociety.com |accessdate=2016-11-02}}</ref> * [[TPP Nikola Tesla]], the largest power plant in Serbia * 128 streets in Croatia had been named after Nikola Tesla as of November 2008, making him the eighth most common street name origin in the country.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.croatia.org/crown/articles/9663/1/Dr-Slaven-Letica-If-Streets-Could-Talk-Kad-bi-ulice-imale-dar-govora.html|title=If Streets Could Talk. Kad bi ulice imale dar govora.|first=Slaven|last=Letica|authorlink=Slaven Letica|publisher=Croatian World Network|issn=1847-3911|editor-first=Nenad|editor-last=Bach|editorlink=Nenad Bach|date=29 November 2008|accessdate=31 December 2014}}{{better source|date=November 2016}}</ref>
{{Commons category|Things named after Nikola Tesla}}
===Schools=== *[[Tesla STEM High School]] created in 2012 in [[Redmond, Washington]] as a choice school with a focus on [[Science, technology, engineering, and mathematics|STEM]] subjects. The name was chosen by a student vote.<ref>{{cite web|title=STEM High School formally named after Nikola Tesla {{!}} Redmond Reporter|url=http://www.redmond-reporter.com/news/stem-high-school-formally-named-after-nikola-tesla/|website=Redmond Reporter|accessdate=6 January 2017|date=21 March 2014}}</ref>
==See also== - [[Nikola Tesla in popular culture]]
